title: New plates fail to boost battered car sector as sales splutter
text:
The car market struggled to bounce back from a double-digit decline in the crucial month of September as new plates failed to lure in drivers.

New car registrations motored 1.3pc higher year-on-year to 343,255 last month, a meagre rebound from a 20pc plunge in September 2018, according to the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders.

Sales slumped last year after the imposition of new emissions standards on cars left manufacturers struggling to get enough certified vehicles onto forecourts in time.

Car makers also pushed a glut of models onto the market ahead of the new rules coming into force.

Diesel sales plunged a further 20pc last month but the slump was offset by a 4.5pc rise in petrol...
description: The car market struggled to bounce back from a double-digit decline in the crucial month of September as new plates failed to lure in drivers.
